intro: Gurania jeffreyi, commonly known as the Jeffrey's gurania, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are characterized by their broad, heart-shaped form and a prominent midrib. Gurania jeffreyi produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
